comment:
Surprisingly enjoyable for such a commercial brand. Lightly smoked, accenting some terrific vanilla tobacco, cinnamon and citrus spices. The burn is pleasant and blunted.

The long you let it sit under the tongue, the more mellow it gets. This would go great with a pipe. The TOBACCO is the dominant flavor to me. This is a really terrific option if the price is right.
Predominant peat on palate but not super pleasant.
Neat. Such an easy drink. Love the peaty flavor.

I really like this blend for an everyday drink.  Find it very sweet, tastes of butterscotch, white raisins, vanilla, and marzipan.  Very little peppery finish and very little peat.  Overall easy to drink.

Nose: smoky, fruits on the back, alcohol aroma

Taste: Vanilla, smoke, peaty, citrus and of course oak

Aftertaste: nice aftertaste, smoky but short

Follow me on insta: @whiskperience

Peat, oak, and vanilla on the nose, in that order. Mild peat, strong oak, citrus, then more peat at the end as it finishes slow and the smoke flavor really releases in the back of the palate at the very end. I thought I didn’t like peat at all, but this might be just the perfect entry level peaty scotch. I may have to get another nip later and see if I feel the same way. Pleasantly surprised.
Good average price for the blended whiskey. This can b my daily drink
Charcoal, black pepper, dry and with very little heat. Just pleasant and easily drinkable.
Little bit of smoke but outside that pretty average.

Nose: roasted almond, butterscotch pudding, dried fruits, orange peel, whiff of peat.

Taste: praline, buttered toast, almond, banana, prune-like sherriness. Light smoke, pepper, and creamy grain on the finish.

A very decent, affordable, well-rounded blend.
Nice blended scotch. Not as smoky as red label, but still you can feel it. Have good body
Nose is light peat, but not overpowering.  First sip is very smooth. Relatively light peat with some almond biscotti notes. Smooth burn that never gets too strong.

Nose - mild peat smoke, musty brine, sweet cream, caramel, orange, plum, raisins, oak notes, light ethanol burn. 

Taste - peat smoke, brine, lightly burnt oak, toffee, vanilla, allspice, coffee/chocolate, mild alcohol burn, finishing very quickly with short lived oaky toffee flavor. 

I can taste the Lagavulin coming through most prominently. However, I only like this one slightly more than the red label, as it doesn’t have the strong burnt oak bitterness. It generally tastes too diluted and largely forgettable.
En Mexico es clásico pero cumple es ahumado y con toques de vainilla y caramelo es excelente
-Not bad, smooth, doesn’t burn as much
Soft peaty taste makes it hard to taste other notes
Hits of creamy vanilla and butterscotch give way to a light peaty taste
Mild smokiness. Smooth but nothing special.

My Rating Glossary:  

Two Stars:           "I'd rather be drinking lite beer."
Two 1/2 Stars:    "Posh rubbish."
Three Stars:        "I love whisk(e)y.  This is average love."
Three 1/2 Stars: "May buy again."
Four Stars:          "I've got to get you into my life."
Four 1/2 Stars:   "Better than drugs."
Five Stars:           "Life is good.  Whisky makes it better."
トロッとした飲み口。アルコールがピリッとくるが、やんわり甘い
Caballito de batalla, zaffaroni con mucho hielo y bueno para mezclas. La relación precio-calidad es honesta

Very solid scotch. Some honey and smokiness on the nose. Same honey sweetness and more smoke on the palate. Short finish but for 30 US dollars you could not go wrong with a bottle of JW Black. Great everyday sipper.
First time trying peat. Not great, not terrible

Nose: sweet marmalade smell like monkey shoulder but with light peat.
Taste: pleasant friendly ripe fruit sweetness with light smoke. 
Allows you to enjoy a peated scotch without your mouth feeling like an ash tray for 30 minutes afterwards.

Starting my journey with this one. Had whiskey before, never have I consciously analyzed its taste though. 

I like its smell more than the actual taste when the beverage is in my mouth. I can scent citrusy notes. 
The aftertaste is another highlight for me, it reminds me of I unripe (green or black skinned) walnuts that I loved to rip off of trees in my backyard in order to smell them. I also get some citrusy notes in the aftertaste.
The very first note when flushing my mouth with whiskey is a very pleasant and subtle sour sensation on my tongue. Sensing an uncommon sweetness short before the aftertaste is presented, I still feel like I am missing a lot of notes during the period of the beverage flushing my mouth- presumably as a beginner I am overwhelmed by the complexity and intensity it’s taste.
A little too peaty for my taste; semi-smooth scotch, though.
There is a nice light smoke that follows the taste of sweetness. A medium finish to end the light whisky
Light smoke on the nose. The palate starts with a pleasant sweetness before the peat comes to the surface and leads to a pleasant, medium finish.
For the price, really not bad at all
Smoky and chocolate notes on the nose

Is a very good 12 years blended scotch, on the nose you get cotton, vanilla, beautiful aroma. On the palate i found caramel. I also got an spicy aroma and its hot in the palate. The finish is medium, hot and dry. i prefer it over Johnnie Blue. Slightly peated. 85 over 100
Vanilla, toffee, butterscotch and fairly smokey. A classic

Alright! Got me a sample of JW Black!

Nose is nice. Some sour fruits and a bit of peat. The peat shows itself more with each taste. About the same on the taste but the peat is a bit more prominent on the backend. There’s a bit of honeyed sweetness there. This has some heat on the finish with a lingering medicinal taste. 

It was ok. I hear great things about JW Green, so I gotta try that next
Bit of smoke to it otherwise bit of caramel and some dried fruit flavour nice with ice
Smokey on the front, but just Smokey for the sake of being Smokey

Nose: Dark fruits, raisins, vanilla.
Palate: Rich, smooth, vanilla cream, dark fruits, pepper.
Finish - Medium, pepper smoke
43% ABV

NOSE: Smoke undertones with a hint of caramel

TASTE: Right away you get the smokey taste mixed with a caramel undertone as the nose suggests. You also pick up vanilla, cereal and a bit of that grainey whiskey taste 

Overall it's a very nice Scotch and is one of my favourite daily drinkers 

82/100

GLASS:
Dalmore Glencairn Copita Nosing Glass

NOSE:
Neat - Golden raisins, ginger, and mustard greens up front followed by secondary notes of peat. 

PALATE:
Neat - Toffee and baking spice followed by vanilla and ginger on the finish. 

CONCLUSION:
The Ford Taurus of Scotch.
Can’t get any more smooth than this
Nose citrus, vanilla, honey. Pallet oak, smoke, honey, lemon.

Much more peated than the red or green. And I LOVE the peat flavor in this. It's very balanced. The smoke isn't as aggressive as Laphroaig 10yr, which works really well in this. However, the grain whisky is too strong and really hurts the flavor profile. Because as you drink you immediately hit that wonderful smoke BUT then it's goes to that hard grain whisky flavor which it ruins the finish (at least for me). I haven't tried the double black but I am interested to see how it compares.
I’m no expert but i love the “bonfire” feel sipping this gives me. And then on the rocks it’s got more vanilla hints. One of my favorites by far
Es un clásico. En nariz el ahumado es imposible no reconocerlo. En boca tiene buen cuerpo y queda en boca lo suficiente para irse yendo suavemente. Buen 12 años

1970s


Peppery, sharp, I do taste the metallicness to this Compared to the previous 1
A lot lighter on the tongue compared to previous, oily 1 
Hits the back of throat more 0.5
0.5

Peppery, Sharp, sherry 2.5
Cinnamon 2.75
Sweet smooth 2.5 

2.5

Nose with a slight alcoholic hint (which with 40%ABV is never a good start), it is still quite fresh and clean, with herbaceous and mineral tones together with yellow fruit (peach, apricot and melon), orange, light vanilla and lemon peel. The peat is really a hint in the background, more vegetable than smoky. All in all pleasant, but so far it has very little of a "black" soul.
The peat comes out in the palate, even if on the background, with an ashy and toasty contribution, while the citrus fruits and the fruity notes of the nose remain frontal with the addition of almonds and butter biscuit. Always herbaceous and fresh, with a light and subtle profile, with alcohol well present (too much) and a certain bitter and metallic note that develops over time.
The finish is rather short, of citrus fruits, ash, metal.
Drinkable but not too much, in small quantities it is pleasant but in the long run it expresses an unpleasant artificial note that breaks the lightness of the whole.
All in all, it keeps what it promises, mixed it gives a touch of ash enough not to stir the spirits, and can be a good starting point for those who want to get closer to Scotch whisky.
Pepper or clove, earthy with hints of honey and fruits on the nose. Spicy and very earthy on the palate. Not bad.

Perhaps still one of the biggest mysteries is why this blended scotch with strong notes of Islay additions is priced lower than $50 a bottle.  While it might push away those who dislike peat and smoke, it is a wonderful addition (some might say basic necessity) for any home bar.

A gentle and surprisingly complex blended scotch!  Inviting with the nose of cinnamon raisin bread, subtlety introduces you to smoke and vanilla, sort of like a burnt crème brûlée, in good way, as hits your mouth. 
Like a baby- laphroaig it try’s to hang in there with the peat. Simple finish as the smoke lingers subtlety and pleasantly. For the price, this is a great scotch to introduce someone to who wants to try something “Smokey”!
Nose of light vanilla, citrus peel, dried berries, and ash. Taste is butter cookie, orange zest, funk, and smoke... warm finish holds on with some baking spices and a tinge of smoke.
I really like this bottle, I know it doesn’t get much love.
Enjoyable, nice peat and smoke get also some butterscotch and citrus taste

The nose of the scotch features notes od peat and sweet vanilla.

On the pallet it is wonderfully smooth with notes of peat and butterscotch.  It is well-balanced with an early sweetness transitioning into a late spice.  A good scotch, best enjoyed neat.
Populaire et commercial certainement mais ça reste un choix sûr.

Sweet notes of vanilla and citrus on the nose. Very predominant peaty taste that lingers for a while on the palate.
Solid Scoth!
Sweet Smokey vanilla on the noise. Strong peaty flavor with a nice tobacco. Very nice finish with a quick finish.
Vanilla flavor. Strong toffee caramel on the nose. Some smokiness.
